poem:
The Marketplace  

In the shadows of the concert hall  
they barter souls, silent echoes  
echo in purses. Notes of longing  
sold for gold, yet priceless, the air  
thick with unsung songs. A pledge  
is whispered, justice seeks its stage  
while music waits, bound in chains  
by unseen hands, yet still it plays.
